arts.ttl: Newcastle United's "torn up" plans revealed & vicious verbal volley from Wimbledon boss
arts.sum: Wimbledon boss Johnnie Jackson did not hold back in his post-game press conference after Newcastle scraped through with a first half penalty. Howe said after the game: "Without the injury to Martin I might have done a couple more at half-time.

arts.ttl: Johnnie Jackson disappointed over Newcastle penalty decision as AFC Wimbledon exit EFL Cup
arts.sum: “Like we’re not up against it enough coming here as the underdog, we don’t need a linesman getting involved, the referee is there to referee the game. Johnnie Jackson was left fuming that his AFC Wimbledon side were knocked out of the EFL Cup on Tuesday night against Newcastle following a “dodgy” penalty decision.

arts.ttl: Newcastle boss highlights AFC Wimbledon’s game plan as Johnnie Jackson’s side suffer narrow EFL Cup defeat
arts.sum: Eddie Howe credited the challenge AFC Wimbledon gave his Newcastle United side as the Premier League secured a 1-0 victory in the EFL Cup third-round clash at St James’ Park on Tuesday evening. Eddie Howe brought on first-teamers Lewis Hall, Anthony Gordon and Bruno Guimaraes in the second half to kill off the cup tie, but the South Londoners stayed resolute.

arts.ttl: Pep Guardiola makes Ilkay Gundogan claim after Newcastle display as he hails response from Man City star
arts.sum: Gundogan scored in 4-0 win over Slovan Bratislava

arts.ttl: Newcastle United have double goalkeeper worry with Fabian Schar also an injury concern
arts.sum: Howe said that Pope is hopeful of recovering for Saturday but has "swelling" on his knee from the clash with Man CIty. Howe, speaking his post-game Press conference, said: "I think he is OK but Martin took a nasty bang to his knee.

arts.ttl: Job done – Eddie Howe fine with ‘instantly forgettable’ win over AFC Wimbledon
arts.sum: Fabian Schar’s penalty was all that separated the teams at the final whistle.

arts.ttl: Newcastle v AFC Wimbledon EFL Cup team line-ups - Pigott partners Bugiel up top with Chelsea last 16 clash up for grabs
arts.sum: Subs: Ward, Furlong, O’Toole, Kelly, Neufville, Smith, Stevens, Williams, Sasu. Joe Pigott, Callum Maycock and Huseyin Biler have all come into the team, with Josh Neufvill, Alistair Smith and Matty Stevens dropping out and named on the bench.

arts.ttl: Senior star strolls to man of the match as Newcastle United fringe men blow big chance
arts.sum: But the game should have been wrapped up long before the end as William Osula missed good chances and Miguel Almiron squandered other opportunities. Newcastle United scraped into round four of the Carabao Cup against AFC Wimbledon thanks to Fabian Schar's first half penalty.

arts.ttl: Newcastle limp past AFC Wimbledon to reach Carabao Cup last 16
arts.sum: NEWCASTLE 1-0 AFC WIMBLEDON: Fabian Schar was on target from the penalty spot for Newcastle as Eddie Howe's side saw off AFC Wimbledon 1-0 in the third round of the Carabao Cup

arts.ttl: William Osula and Miguel Almiron fire blanks as Newcastle United stumble into round four
arts.sum: Two minutes later Miguel Almiron slipped the ball to William Osula but again the lower league visitors were quick to crowd United out and the danger was cleared after Joe Lewis dispossessed the striker. Gordon got in on the act mid-way into the second half with a good run and cross from the left to the back post for Almiron.
